column4: if I want to search for a file in terminal, whats the command?
thanks
you can use 'locate'
you can also look at 'whereis' and 'find', read their man pages
ok, I searched for "httpd.conf" but I got nothing with find and locate.
are you sure you used the right syntax for find?, if the file is recent you will need to update the database that locate uses with 'sudo updatedb'
no 's' at the end
you are installing php from source?  why?
testing mostly :)
try 'sudo apt-get build-dep php5'
plus that I didn't like that they put things in /etc/
ah,
that seems interesting :)
if you use gnome terminal there is an option in the profile, otherwise mute the pc speaker
nope, i've not installed gnome yet, i'm at a server install.
how do I mute the pc-speaker?
i *think*: xset b off,
actually no, i just read the man, it's for X as the name implies.
Dr_Willis: thanks for the help, I'll install xset and see if it works =)
it's in multiverse, have you enabled it?
edit /etc/hostname and /etc/hosts accordingly
thanks!
